description: This method converts kitchen waste into compost using a pit, promoting sustainable waste management and enriching soil.
steps: Dig a pit in the ground.
Add a layer of dry leaves at the bottom of the pit.
Layer kitchen waste on top of the dry leaves.
Add a layer of soil over the kitchen waste.
Optionally, mix cow dung slurry to speed up decomposition.
Cover the pit to avoid smell and flies.
Mix the contents weekly to aid decomposition.
Wait for 6 to 8 weeks for compost to be ready.
risks: Imbalance in composting if too much wet waste is added
